nodes.content: Progression on erlotinib (± ramucirumab or bevacizumab), afatinib, gefitinib, dacomitinib
Consider definitive local therapy (eg, SABR or surgery) for limited lesions
Continue afatinib or dacomitinib or gefitinib or erlotinib (± bevacizumab or ramucirumab) (if T790M-)
Continue afatinib or dacomitinib or gefitinib or erlotinib (± bevacizumab or ramucirumab) (if T790M-)
Consider definitive local therapy (eg, SABR or surgery)
Continue afatinib or dacomitinib or gefitinib or erlotinib (± bevacizumab or ramucirumab) (if T790M-)
Systemic therapy Adenocarcinoma (NSCL-K 1 of 5) or Squamous Cell Carcinoma (NSCL-K 2 of 5)
Progression, see therapy for multiple lesions, below

tree_references.description: Next step upon progression after Osimertinib
Guideline reference for CNS cancer treatment
Systemic therapy options for Squamous Cell Carcinoma
Principles of Image-Guided Thermal Ablation Therapy
Principles of Molecular and Biomarker Analysis
Molecular or Biomarker-Directed Therapy for Advanced or Metastatic Disease

footnotes.label: o
footnotes.content: IGTA therapy (eg, cryotherapy, microwave, radiofrequency) may be an option for select patients. See Principles of Image-Guided Thermal Ablation Therapy (NSCL-D).

footnotes.label: nn
footnotes.content: Principles of Molecular and Biomarker Analysis (NSCL-H).

footnotes.label: rr
footnotes.content: Molecular or Biomarker-Directed Therapy for Advanced or Metastatic Disease (NSCL-J).

footnotes.label: uu
footnotes.content: Criteria for treatment with bevacizumab: nonsquamous NSCLC, and no recent history of hemoptysis.

footnotes.label: yy
footnotes.content: Beware of flare phenomenon in subset of patients who discontinue TKI. If disease flare occurs, restart TKI.

footnotes.label: zz
footnotes.content: Clinical trials have included up to 3 to 5 progressing sites.

footnotes.label: aaa
footnotes.content: Consider a biopsy at time of progression to rule out SCLC transformation (approximately 6%) and biopsy or plasma testing to evaluate mechanisms of resistance. See Principles of Molecular and Biomarker Analysis (NSCL-H) and NCCN Guidelines for Small Cell Lung Cancer.

footnotes.label: bbb
footnotes.content: Definitive local therapy of CNS disease can include asymptomatic lesions at risk for symptomatic progression based on factors including site, location, and edema.

footnotes.label: ddd
footnotes.content: Afatinib + cetuximab may be considered in patients with disease progression on EGFR TKI therapy.

footnotes.label: eee
footnotes.content: The data in the second-line setting suggest that PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitor monotherapy is less effective, irrespective of PD-L1 expression, in EGFR exon 19 deletion or exon 21 L858R, ALK+ NSCLC.

footnotes.label: fff
footnotes.content: Plasma or tissue-based testing via broad molecular profiling should be considered at progression, for the T790M mutation and other genomic resistance mechanisms. If plasma-based testing is negative, tissue-based testing with rebiopsy material is strongly recommended. Practitioners may want to consider scheduling the biopsy concurrently with plasma testing referral.

footnotes.label: ggg
footnotes.content: Consider osimertinib (regardless of T790M status) for progressive CNS disease or leptomeningeal disease. In the BLOOM study, osimertinib was used at 160 mg once daily for patients with leptomeningeal disease.

footnotes.label: hhh
footnotes.content: In the randomized phase III trial of dacomitinib, patients with brain metastases were not eligible for enrollment. In the setting of brain metastases, consider other options.

image_title: EGFR EXON 19 DELETION OR EXON 21 L858R MUTATIONS - SUBSEQUENT THERAPY
